item.title: [UNITEDTE] United Textiles Ltd to Consider and Approve Unaudited Quarterly Results on Feb 12, 2026
item.description:
United Textiles Ltd has announced a Board Meeting on February 12, 2026, to consider and approve the unaudited quarterly results for the period ended 31st December 2025. The meeting will be held at the company's registered office at 7â„¢ K.M.STONE, Barwala Road, Hisar. The trading window for dealing with securities of the company will be closed from 31/12/2025 to 48 hours after the declaration of the Financial Results.

  • United Textiles Ltd to consider and approve unaudited quarterly results for the period ended 31st December 2025.
  • Board Meeting scheduled on 12th February, 2026 at 3.00 P.M.
  • Meeting to be held at the company's registered office at 7â„¢ K.M.STONE, Barwala Road, Hisar.
  • Trading window for dealing with securities of the company will be closed from 31/12/2025 to 48 hours after the declaration of the Financial Results.

item.title: [SHAKTIPUMP] Shakti Pumps India Ltd.'s ESG Score Increases to 67.6 in FY 2024-25
item.description:
SES ESG Research Private Limited has issued an ESG Report on Shakti Pumps India Ltd. The overall ESG score of the company has increased from 60.7 in FY 2023-24 to 67.6 in FY 2024-25. This report has been independently prepared by SES ESG Research Pvt. Ltd. using publicly available information, and the company has not engaged them for ESG Ratings.

  • SES ESG Research Private Limited has issued an ESG Report on Shakti Pumps India Ltd.
  • The overall ESG score of the company has increased from 60.7 in FY 2023-24 to 67.6 in FY 2024-25.
  • The report has been prepared independently by SES ESG Research Pvt. Ltd.
  • Shakti Pumps India Ltd. has not engaged SES ESG Research Pvt. Ltd. for ESG Ratings.

Company: SHAKTI PUMPS (INDIA) LTD.-$ | Category: Monthly Update

item.title: [KEI] KEI Industries Ltd Announces Voluntary Delisting from Calcutta Stock Exchange
item.description:
KEI Industries Ltd has announced the voluntary delisting of its Equity Shares from The Calcutta Stock Exchange Limited. This decision is in accordance with Regulations 5 and 6 of the SEBI (Delisting of Equity Shares) Regulations, 2021. The advertisement regarding this notice was published on 24% January, 2026 in Business Standards (English and Hindi editions) and Arthik Lipi (Bengali).

  • KEI Industries Ltd has decided to voluntarily delist its Equity Shares from The Calcutta Stock Exchange Limited.
  • The decision is in accordance with the SEBI (Delisting of Equity Shares) Regulations, 2021.
  • The advertisement regarding this notice was published on 24% January, 2026 in Business Standards (English and Hindi editions) and Arthik Lipi (Bengali).

ðŸ“„ Read Official Filing (PDF)


Company: KEI INDUSTRIES LTD. | Category: Delisting

item.title: [JTLIND] JTL Industries Q3 FY26: EBITDA Up 11.56% QoQ, PAT Up 19% QoQ
item.description:
ðŸ”¥ Trending

JTL Industries, a fast-growing steel tube manufacturing company, has reported its financial results for the quarter ended December 31, 2025. The company's revenue from operations stood at 4,705 Million, with EBITDA at 386 million and PAT at 265 million. The quarter on quarter comparisons show an increase in total revenue by 9.95%, EBITDA by 11.56%, and PAT by 19.37%. The 9 months comparison shows a decrease in EBITDA by 7.74% and PAT by 20.48%. The company's performance highlights include a significant increase in EBITDA per MT, indicating a strong margin recovery.

  • Revenue from Operations stood at 4,705 Million
  • EBITDA at 386 million
  • PAT at 265 million
  • EBITDA per MT rose to 4,270
  • Significant increase in EBITDA and PAT QoQ

ðŸ“„ Read Official Filing (PDF)


Company: JTL Industries Ltd | Category: Quarterly Result

item.title: [NARBADA] Narbada Gems and Jewellery Ltd. Reconstitutes Internal Complaints Committee
item.description:
Narbada Gems and Jewellery Ltd. has passed a resolution by circulation on 24.01.2026 for the reconstitution of the Internal Complaints Committee (ICC) under the Sexual Harassment of Women at Workplace (Prevention, Prohibition and Redressal) Act, 2013. The new committee comprises of Ms. Sakshi Sanghi as Presiding Officer, Ms.K. Venkat Lakshmi as External Member, Mr. Sachin Upadhyaya as Member, Ms. Maddi Rajini as Member and Ms. Kadaboena Akhila as Member. This move aligns with the SEBI (Listing Obligations and Disclosure Requirements) Regulations, 2015.

  • Narbada Gems and Jewellery Ltd. reconstitutes Internal Complaints Committee
  • Ms. Sakshi Sanghi appointed as Presiding Officer
  • Ms.K. Venkat Lakshmi appointed as External Member
  • Mr. Sachin Upadhyaya, Ms. Maddi Rajini, and Ms. Kadaboena Akhila appointed as Members
  • Reconstitution in compliance with SEBI (Listing Obligations and Disclosure Requirements) Regulations, 2015

ðŸ“„ Read Official Filing (PDF)


Company: NARBADA GEMS AND JEWELLERY LTD. | Category: Board Meeting

item.title: [NAVINFLUOR] Navin Fluorine International Ltd. Receives ESG Rating Score of '66.7' by SES ESG Research Private Limited
item.description:
Navin Fluorine International Ltd. has been assigned an ESG (Environmental, Social, and Governance) Rating score of '66.7' by SES ESG Research Private Limited. This rating was assigned based on data available in the public domain, and the company did not engage SES ESG Research Private Limited for this rating. The company has disclosed this information in accordance with Regulation 30 of the SEBI (Listing Obligations and Disclosure Requirements) Regulations, 2015. The rating can be found on the SES ESG website.

  • Navin Fluorine International Ltd. received an ESG Rating score of '66.7' from SES ESG Research Private Limited.
  • The rating was assigned based on publicly available data.
  • The company did not engage SES ESG Research Private Limited for this rating.
  • The disclosure was made in accordance with SEBI Listing Regulations.
  • The rating can be found on the SES ESG website.

Company: Navin Fluorine International Limited-$ | Category: Rating

item.title: [KOTAKBANK] Kotak Mahindra Bank Ltd. Proposes to Raise Funds up to Rs. 15,000 Crore through NCDs in FY 2026-27
item.description:
Kotak Mahindra Bank Ltd. has announced a proposal to raise funds by issuing Unsecured, Redeemable, Non-Convertible Debentures (NCDs) worth up to Rs. 15,000 crore in the financial year 2026-27. The bank's Board of Directors approved this proposal at their meeting on January 24, 2026. The NCDs will be issued on a private placement basis, and the bank may release them in one or more tranches/series, subject to the approval of the bank's members and any other necessary approvals. The bank's Board Meeting commenced at 12:15 p.m. (IST) and ended at 2:20 p.m. (IST). The information is also available on the bank's website in accordance with the Securities and Exchange Board of India (Listing Obligations and Disclosure Requirements) Regulations, 2015.

  • Kotak Mahindra Bank proposes to raise funds up to Rs. 15,000 crore through NCDs
  • The bank's Board of Directors approved the proposal on January 24, 2026
  • NCDs will be issued on a private placement basis
  • The funds may be raised in one or more tranches/series
  • The proposal is subject to the approval of the bank's members and necessary regulatory approvals

ðŸ“„ Read Official Filing (PDF)


Company: KOTAK MAHINDRA BANK LTD. | Category: Investment

item.title: [SUPER] Senior Management Personnel, Mr. Hariharan A J, Resigns from Super Sales India Ltd.
item.description:
Super Sales India Ltd. has announced the resignation of Mr. Hariharan A J, a Senior Management Personnel and DGM HR. He has submitted his resignation due to personal commitments and will be relieved from the closure of office hours today. The company provided a copy of his resignation letter and the details as required under Regulation 30 of the Listing Regulations.

  • Mr. Hariharan A J, Senior Management Personnel and DGM HR, resigns from Super Sales India Ltd.
  • Resignation is due to personal commitments.
  • Mr. Hariharan A J will be relieved from the closure of office hours today.
  • Company has provided a copy of his resignation letter.
  • Details are provided as per Regulation 30 of the Listing Regulations.

item.title: [KOTAKBANK] Kotak Mahindra Bank Announces Q3FY26 Results: Consolidated PAT up 5% YoY, Standalone PAT up 4% YoY
item.description:
ðŸ”¥ Trending

Kotak Mahindra Bank announced its financial results for the quarter and nine months ended December 31, 2025. The consolidated PAT for Q3FY26 stood at â‚¹ 4,924 crore, up 5% YoY and 10% QoQ. The standalone PAT for Q3FY26 was â‚¹ 3,446 crore, up 4% YoY and 6% QoQ. The Bank's total customer assets grew to â‚¹ 598,780 crore, up 15% YoY. The total domestic MF AUM increased by 20% YoY to â‚¹ 586,610 crore. The Bank's standalone results showed that net advances increased 16% YoY to â‚¹ 480,673 crore. The Bank's PAT for Q3FY26 increased to â‚¹ 3,446 crore, up 4% YoY from â‚¹ 3,305 crore in Q3FY25. The Bank's GNPA was 1.30% and NNPA was 0.31% as at December 31, 2025.

  • Consolidated PAT for Q3FY26 at â‚¹ 4,924 crore, up 5% YoY and 10% QoQ
  • Standalone PAT for Q3FY26 at â‚¹ 3,446 crore, up 4% YoY and 6% QoQ
  • Total customer assets grew to â‚¹ 598,780 crore, up 15% YoY
  • Total domestic MF AUM increased by 20% YoY to â‚¹ 586,610 crore
  • Net advances increased 16% YoY to â‚¹ 480,673 crore

item.title: [KOTAKBANK] Kotak Mahindra Bank Ltd Announces Q3 and Nine Months Results for 2025
item.description:
Kotak Mahindra Bank Ltd has announced its consolidated and standalone unaudited financial results for the quarter and nine months ended December 31, 2025. The meeting of the Board of Directors, which commenced at 12:15 p.m. (IST) and consideration of the item on approval of Consolidated and Standalone Unaudited Financial Results concluded at 1:50 p.m. (IST), approved the financial results. The financial results, along with the Limited Review Report, are enclosed and hosted on the Bank's website. The review was conducted in accordance with the Standard on Review Engagements and the circular issued by the Securities and Exchange Board of India under Regulation 33(8) of the Listing Regulations.

  • Kotak Mahindra Bank Ltd announced its consolidated and standalone unaudited financial results for the quarter and nine months ended December 31, 2025.
  • The review was conducted in accordance with the Standard on Review Engagements and the circular issued by the Securities and Exchange Board of India under Regulation 33(8) of the Listing Regulations.
  • The financial results were approved by the Board of Directors in a meeting that commenced at 12:15 p.m. (IST) and concluded at 1:50 p.m. (IST).
  • The financial results are enclosed and hosted on the Bank's website.
  • The review report was submitted by the Joint Statutory Auditors of the Bank.

ðŸ“„ Read Official Filing (PDF)


Company: KOTAK MAHINDRA BANK LTD. | Category: Quarterly Result
